feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission shows a working financial application through multiple concrete features and demonstrations: asset-level analysis (ticker input and thesis), portfolio analytics (composition/diversification), and scenario stress-testing with projected impacts. IMPLEMENT evidence of iterative builds plus DISCOVER/REFLECT context confirm comprehensive, functioning financial app rather than a vague concept.
- Integrate AI: The submission demonstrates concrete AI integration across multiple, functional components (asset analysis, portfolio snapshot, scenario lab) with examples (Tesla analysis, diversification score, stress-test) and uses APIs, memory state, and iterative prompt engineering—showing the AI adds substantive value. The student's IMPLEMENT and REFLECT stages confirm thoughtful design and handling of limitations, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "So it's a instant AI powered reality check for any public asset. You can type in any uh timber sickle or ticker symbol or asset name."
"But how I went about this was first I did the asset analyzer, then for version two to upgrade it, I did the portfolio snapshot, and then for version three, I added the scenario lab."
"So, when we run this stress stress test, tells us our information up here and our projected impact and how it might in affect our portfolio."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- DISCOVER: Defined the task and target users ("build an investment analysis model... used by retail investors") establishing the financial-app goal.
- IMPLEMENT: Demonstrated development and iteration (asset analyzer, portfolio snapshot, scenario lab) and live examples (Tesla analysis, portfolio inputs, stress test) showing the app performs financial functions.
- REFLECT: Discussed trust, disclaimers, and ethical considerations, supporting the app's practical financial use and responsible deployment.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows a working financial application through multiple concrete features and demonstrations: asset-level analysis (ticker input and thesis), portfolio analytics (composition/diversification), and scenario stress-testing with projected impacts. IMPLEMENT evidence of iterative builds plus DISCOVER/REFLECT context confirm comprehensive, functioning financial app rather than a vague concept.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "So this model will roughly include a way to analyze assets, also a way to rate your portfolio and see any hidden risk involved and then also perform a scenario lab to test the portfolio durability during certain economic events."

"But before I dive into what it does, this is the prompt that I went about. ... So then after it put out that, I added some additional instructions to better um, better make this. And a lot of it was just me going back and forth with the AI um trying to figure out um how to best build it and make it clear enough for the user to understand."
"It mainly includes external data integration via APIs uh memory state that can influence recommendations as shown here and then also multiple sanity checks and disclaimers."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: defined the AI-driven goal and user need (asset analysis, portfolio rating, scenario lab).
- Implement: described prompt engineering, iterative back-and-forth with the model, versioned features (asset analyzer, portfolio snapshot, scenario lab), and API/data integration.
- Reflect: evaluated user impact, prompt-engineering challenges, and ethical/disclaimer considerations supporting effective AI use.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates concrete AI integration across multiple, functional components (asset analysis, portfolio snapshot, scenario lab) with examples (Tesla analysis, diversification score, stress-test) and uses APIs, memory state, and iterative prompt engineering—showing the AI adds substantive value. The student's IMPLEMENT and REFLECT stages confirm thoughtful design and handling of limitations, meeting the PASS standard.
